Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: Great teacher and willing to help. Despite being an L1 course, I feel I learned a great amount of German vocabulary, grammar, structure.
basic elementary german reading comprehension, little speaking
This course helped me develop basic conversational skills in German, as well as a basic understanding of German culture.
This course really improved my independent learning skills. I had to figure out how to learn all the vocabulary on my own and it really helped me establish good studying habits.
I learnt how to speak some German, a taste of some German culture and History.
Very well paced and does not require any changes.
strictly speaking german L1 provides little to no support / help to students taking language for first time
The course is taught very well with the primary goal of teaching students to speak conversationally constantly kept in mind.

I liked the fast pace of this course. We learned a lot of German in a short amount of time. I would have liked to watch more movies or listen to more songs perhaps instead of the webquests which I didnt find useful.
I would recommend this course and professor to anyone unsure of which language to take.
If you want to learn a new language I really recommend this course. It was easy to follow and very fast paced!
Yes, it is a very engaging level one class and has a lot of course work to help a student learn the language.
